solution_line_template: On the first day, she walks {initial_steps_morning} + {additional_steps_first_day} = <<{initial_steps_morning}+{additional_steps_first_day}={steps_day1}>>{steps_day1} steps.
The next day she walks twice the steps, which is {multiplier_twice}*{steps_day1} = <<{multiplier_twice}*{steps_day1}={steps_day2}>>{steps_day2}
The total number of steps after the two days are {steps_day2}+{steps_day1} = <<{steps_day2}+{steps_day1}={total_steps_day1_day2}>>{total_steps_day1_day2}

On the third day, she walks an additional {additional_steps_day3} steps, bringing the three-day total to {total_steps_day1_day2}+{additional_steps_day3}=<<{total_steps_day1_day2}+{additional_steps_day3}={total_steps_three_days}>>{total_steps_three_days} steps
